TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DataSourceOperation extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Specifies a data operation performed by a data source control.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation> enumeration represents the actions that a data source control can perform on its underlying data. Data source controls such as <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.SqlDataSource> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ObjectDataSource> use these enumeration values to track the type of operation being performed.
The five major data source operations are represented by the <xref:System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation> enumeration. The Select and SelectCount values indicate operations that retrieve data from an underlying data source, while the Delete, Insert, and Update values indicate operations that modify data.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation Delete = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The operation deletes records from a data source.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation Insert = int32(1)

Docs.summary: The operation inserts one or more records into a data source.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation Select = int32(2)

Docs.summary: The operation retrieves records from a data source.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation SelectCount = int32(4)

Docs.summary: The operation retrieves the total number of records for a query from the data source.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Web.UI.DataSourceOperation Update = int32(3)

Docs.summary: The operation updates records in a data source.
